articles.description:
Glitch Hover Effect


Nazanin Ashrafi shared a series of creative button effects this month, all built with pure HTML and CSS. The animations are simple yet cleverly executed and well-achieved. This glitching button changing shapes and colors caught my attention, but check her profile but other cool button designs.








  
  
  Text circle animation


Scroll the page at different speeds and watch how the animation adapts in real time. It's mesmerizing and almost hypnotic. The fact that this is HTML and CSS only is mind blowing. Stijn Van Minnebruggen used scroll-driven animations to create this spinning word-wheel and took it to another level. Amazing demo!








  
  
  Product Swiper


Tired of the same old product pages on e-commerce sites? Diana Moretti brings a fresh twist with aâ€¦

Letâ€™s build something that pays you back.
React devs often forget we hold superpowers:
We can prototype ideas in hours.
We know APIs and how to stitch products together.
We can ship polished, production-ready web apps.
You donâ€™t need to build the next Stripe. You just need to solve a \$997 problem for someone â€” and React is the perfect toolkit for tâ€¦

articles.author: Sana Muhammad Sadiq
articles.description:
Introduction


Iâ€™m continuing my 30-day Linux challenge as part of my preparation for the RHCSA exam, and todayâ€™s topic might just be a lifesaver for system admins and everyday users alike: understanding disk space usage with df, du and how to find whatâ€™s clogging up your system.
Index



Why Disk Space Awareness Matters
What is df
What is du
Real Time Scenario
Industrial Insight
Recommendations
Quick Summary
Running out of disk space can silently break a system whether it's preventing new files from being written, blocking services or even crashing processes. Being proactive is key.
Thatâ€™s where df and du come in, they give you a clear picture of what's full, why, and how to fix it.
df (Disk Free) reports available and used disk space on file systems.
df -h


$ df -h
Filesystem      Size â€¦
articles.title: Disk Space Awareness: df, du and What is Filling Up Your System

articles.author: Sana Muhammad Sadiq
articles.description:
Introduction


As I continue my 30-day Linux challenge in preparation for the RHCSA exam. Today is about something powerful yet surprisingly elegant: gracefully managing running processes in Linux. Each command, each concept is another step toward mastery.
Index



What Happens When a Process Misbehaves
kill
pkill
killall
Real World Scenario
Pro Tips
Quick Summary
Sometimes, a process freezes, eats up memory, or refuses to quit. Thatâ€™s where Linux gives us three mighty tools to step in with authority but grace too.
kill
pkill
killall
Letâ€™s understand how each works.
The Precision Tool 
kill is used to send signals to specific processes using their PID (Process ID).
kill -SIGTERM 1234


This sends a polite request (SIGTERM) asking the process to stop. Want to force it?
kill -9 1234   # SIGKâ€¦
articles.title: Killing Processes Gracefully with kill, pkill and killall

articles.author: Sana Muhammad Sadiq
articles.description:
Introduction


As I continue my 30-Day Linux Challenge for RHCSA preparation with the #CloudWhistler community led by Ali Sohail. Today Iâ€™m diving into a topic that helps you see what's really happening inside your Linux system process monitoring. In this article, Iâ€™m exploring three powerful commands: ps, top and htop.
Index



What Are Processes in Linux
ps Process Snapshot
top Real Time Process Viewer
htop Enhanced Top
Real Life Use Cases
Recommendations
Quick Summary
Every running task or application in Linux is a process. These include services, system tasks and commands you run in the terminal.
Being able to view and manage processes is essential to troubleshoot, monitor system load and understand how your machine is performing.
The ps command gives you a snapshot of currently runninâ€¦
articles.title: Viewing Processes with ps, top and htop

articles.description:
ðŸ“š Table of Contents



Intro: RHEL 9, Cloud Services, and You
First Off, What Even Is "The Cloud"?

articles.author: Abhishek Dave
articles.description:
Originally published at ssojet
The Model Context Protocol (MCP) is gaining traction in the Java ecosystem, particularly within frameworks like Quarkus and Spring AI. Developers can now run MCP servers more efficiently using tools such as JBang. The MCP Java Server Configuration Generator simplifies the process for Java developers.
MCP, introduced by Anthropic, serves as an open standard enabling applications to provide context to Large Language Models (LLMs). Companies like OpenAI and Google have shown support for it. Most recently, GitHub announced support for MCP servers for VS Code users.
MCP allows developers to expose functionalities in the form of tools that integrate with LLMs. The protocol supports communication via standard input and Server-Side Events (SSE). Java frameworks are wâ€¦
articles.title: Model Context Protocol Adoption and C# SDK Integration in Java

articles.author: Abhishek Dave
articles.description:
Originally published at ssojet
The Microsoft Dev Proxy team has announced the release of version 0.27, enhancing developer experience through new features and improvements. This tool, previously known as Microsoft 365 Developer Proxy, helps in mimicking genuine API behaviors during application testing. 
One major addition is the capability to generate TypeSpec definitions from intercepted requests. This feature allows developers to quickly create TypeSpec definitions from real traffic, streamlining the API modeling process. It works similarly to generating OpenAPI specifications, enhancing productivity.
Another important feature is the experimental Dev Proxy MCP server, enabling configuration using natural language. This aims to simplify the user experience and enhance understanding of Devâ€¦
articles.title: Dev Proxy v0.27: New API Modeling and AI Features Released

articles.author: Generatecode
articles.description:
In the rapidly evolving world of Python programming, developers often need to ensure that their functions are both type-safe and versatile. In this article, we'll explore a scenario where a Python function is designed to parse raw bytes data into an instance of a class, and how to extend its signature to accommodate values represented by a JSON string.
Understanding the Function Signature
The given function signature is as follows:
from typing import Type, TypeVar

T = TypeVar('T')
def parse(data: bytes, cls: Type[T]) -> T:
    ...

The parse function accepts two parameters: data, which is of type bytes, and cls, which is a type that must follow the requirements of a class. The return type is also the same as this class type. This function is great for converting a JSON object from raw bytâ€¦
articles.title: How to Extend Python Function Signature for Type Safety?

articles.author: Amol Kavitkar
articles.description:
Step by step guide for Developerâ€™s using Multipass and k3d
K3s is a lightweight Kubernetes distribution designed for resource-constrained environments, making it ideal for local development or edge computing. However, building K3s from source on macOS isnâ€™t straightforward, since K3s requires a Linux environment to compile. In this guide, weâ€™ll walk through how to build K3s from source using Canonicalâ€™s Multipass, transfer the resulting image to your Mac, and then run it using k3d.
Prerequisites:
Before we begin, ensure that Homebrew is installed on your macOS system. You can install all required dependencies using Homebrew.
Multipass is a fast and easy way to spin up lightweight Linux virtual machines (VMs) on macOS. Weâ€™ll use it to create a Linux environment where K3s can be built. Instaâ€¦
articles.title: How to Build and Run K3s on macOS with Multipass and k3d

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Christopher Tepedino
articles.description:
The Guiding and Establishing National Innovation for US Stablecoins of 2025 Act, known as the GENIUS Act, failed to pass cloture in the United States Senate on May 8, dealing a slight blow to cryptocurrency regulation in the country.
The bill, sponsored by Senator Bill Hagerty and co-sponsored by Senators Tim Scott, Kirsten Gillibrand, Cynthia Lummis and Angela Alsobrooks, received last-minute pushback from Democrats, who took aim at the bill and raised concerns about US President Donald Trumpâ€™s cryptocurrency ventures.
To address the concerns of Senate Democrats, the bill had already been amended to include stricter requirements for stablecoin issuers for further provisions for Anti-Money Laundering.
The GENIUS Act was seen as a bipartisan effort to increase regulatory clarity for digital assets in the United States. The focus of the bill, stablecoins used for payments, was looked at as extending dollar dominance internationally and straying away from more controversial crypto topics.
After the procedure failed, Senate Majority Leader John Thune criticized Democrats, saying, â€œDemocrats have been accommodated every step of the way [â€¦] frankly, I just donâ€™t get it.â€
This is a developing story, and further information will be added as it becomes available.
articles.title: US Stablecoin bill blocked as Democrats withdraw support

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Turner Wright
articles.description:
US President Donald Trump was reportedly manipulated by a lobbyist tied to Ripple Labs into announcing the XRP token would be part of his plans for a national cryptocurrency reserve.
According to a May 8 Politico report, an employee of pro-Trump lobbyist Brian Ballard gave the president the text to a social media post she recommended he write announcing a US strategic crypto reserve that would include XRP, Solana (SOL), andÂ Cardano (ADA). After he posted the message to his social media platform on March 2, Trump learned Ripple was one of Ballardâ€™s clients, infuriating the president, who felt like heâ€™d been used, Politico reported, citing two people familiar with the incident.
â€œHe is not welcome in anything anymore,â€ said Trump, referencing Ballard, according to the report.
March 2 Truth Soâ€¦
articles.title: Trump tricked into pushing XRP for crypto reserve: Report

The US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) is considering rule changes to let companies more freely issue tokenized securities, SEC Commissioner Hester Peirce said in a speech published on May 8.
The regulator is â€œconsidering a potential exemptive orderâ€ for firms using blockchain technology to â€œissue, trade, and settle securitiesâ€ that would release them from certain registration requirements, Peirce said in the speech.
For example, decentralized exchanges (DEXs) may no longer need to register â€œas a broker-dealer, clearing agency, or an exchange,â€ Peirce said. The SEC has previously sent numerous Wells notices to DEXs such as Uniswap for allegedly failing to register as securities exchanges.

articles.title: SEC considers new rules easing security token issuance

But maybe theyâ€™ve become too successful, drawing chain activity and fee income from the parent that spawned them? At least thatâ€™s what some are suggesting lately, most recently at Cornell Techâ€™s blockchain conference in late April.
Indeed, some think Ethereum should be a little greedier, or at least fight harder for a bigger part of the revenue pie, particularly sequencing fees.Â 
â€œPeople in the Ethereum Foundation [the nonprofit that supports the Ethereum ecosystem] will tell you that, â€˜Yes, we effed up by being too ivory tower.â€™ I have heard that multiple times,â€ said David Hoffman, an owner at Bankless, during a panel discussion at the â€¦
articles.title: Are layer 2s good for Ethereum, or are they â€˜extractive?â€™

articles.description:
Missouri House Bill 594, a bill that would eliminate capital gains tax in the US state, has passed a vote in the state House of Representatives and now heads to Missouri Governor Mike Kehoe's desk for signature.
According to attorney Aaron Brogan, the bill stipulates a 100% income tax deduction for any capital gains income because the Missouri tax code does not explicitly distinguish between capital gains and income tax.
Missouri House Bill 594 proposes exempting capital gains from income taxes. Source: Missouri House of Representatives
Brogan told Cointelegraph that the specific mechanism to exempt capital gains taxes outlined in HB 594 is unique and compared it to a similar income tax deduction in the federal tax code. The attorney explained:
"The most natural comparison is the state andâ€¦
articles.title: Missouri bill ending capital gains tax heads to governor for signature

Bitcoin price chart in the past year. Source: CoinGecko

Itâ€™s 2025, and over 560 million people worldwide are already using cryptocurrency â€” roughly 17 times the population of Tokyo. Thatâ€™s a vibrant community, yet for every user whoâ€™s embraced it, billions more stand on the sidelines, put off by the complicated interactions and clunky interfaces of protocols, platforms, decentralized apps (DApps), and mobile applications. Why? Blockchain technology offers game-changing potential â€” decentralized ownership, secure trades â€” but letâ€™s face it: Most people still find it intimidating, risky, and confusing. User experience (UX) might just be the deciding factor in whether cryptocurrency achieves mass adoption or remains a niche segment.

According to Hut8â€™s latest quarterly report released on May 8, the firm saw a net loss of $134.3 million despite revenue of $21.8 million. The firmâ€™s CEO, Asher Genoot, explained that this was a result of large-scale investments. 
â€œAs reflected in our results, the first quarter was a deliberate and necessary phase of investment,â€ Genoot said. â€œWe believe the returns on this work will become increasingly visible in the quarters ahead.â€
Hut 8 operations reached a total energy capacity of 1,020 megawatts as of March 31, enough to power well over 800,000 average homes in the United States. The company also has the right to scale up its operation by another 2,600 MW.

Bitcoin (BTC) has long been branded as â€œdigital gold,â€ a store of value for believers in scarcity, decentralization and self-sovereignty. As institutional interest grows, geopolitics shift, and new layers emerge on Bitcoinâ€™s stack, is it time for the narrative to evolve?Â

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Bradley Peak
articles.description:
Key takeaways
After the shutdown of Coinhive in 2019, browser mining has made a comeback with new tools like CryptoTab Browser, Pi Network and YouHolder.
Mining with a browser can cost more in electricity than the crypto earned, especially for users with mid-range devices.
Despite being less energy-intensive than ASIC farms, browser mining still adds up in terms of cumulative power draw and puts a strain on your deviceâ€™s hardware.
Browser mining is evolving with the help of WebAssembly (Wasm), improving script efficiency and creating a smoother user experience.Â 

Browser-based crypto mining sounds like a dream: Just open a webpage, let it run, and your computer starts earning crypto in the background. No bulky ASICs, no GPU farms, no long setup tutorials â€” just your browser doing the heavyâ€¦
articles.title: Browser-based crypto mining in 2025: Still viable or virtually dead?

articles.description:
Smart contract platform Rootstock, the home of decentralized finance (DeFi) on Bitcoin, saw a sharp increase in network security and mining engagement in the first quarter of 2025, even as activity cooled.
Merged mining participation surged to an all-time high of 81%, up from 56.4% in Q4 2024, driven by the integration of major mining pools Foundry and SpiderPool, according to Messariâ€™s first â€œState of Rootstockâ€ report for 2025, shared with Cointelegraph.
The heightened miner interest boosted Rootstockâ€™s hash power to over 740 exahashes per second, surpassing the total Bitcoin network hashrate recorded in October 2024. As a result, the network is now considered to be in a â€œmature phaseâ€ of merged mining growth.
The increased security coincided with a 60% reduction in transaction fees, impâ€¦
articles.title: Bitcoin DeFi sees surge in mining participation despite drop in TVL

Sweat is rolling out support for Base, Ethereum, Arbitrum and BNB Chain. Within the app, users can now bridge assets and swap native tokens across networks, with the option to pay gas fees in Sweat (SWEAT) tokens.

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Amin Haqshanas
articles.description:
Space and Time, a blockchain project supported by Microsoft, has launched its public, permissionless mainnet to bring zero-knowledge (ZK)-proven data infrastructure to crypto applications.
Built by MakeInfinite Labs, Space and Time offers a decentralized, verifiable database for smart contracts to query historical, crosschain and offchain data, according to a news release shared with Cointelegraph.
The platform indexes data from major networks like Ethereum and makes it accessible through a decentralized network of validators. Developers can query this data using Space and Timeâ€™s Proof of SQL â€” a sub-second ZK coprocessor that delivers cryptographic proofs with every query.
â€œPrior to Space and Time, onchain applications had no way to query basic user data from a database of blockchain actiâ€¦

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Bradley Peak
articles.description:
Is your gaming PC capable of mining crypto?            
            
                
As of May 2025, Bitcoin mining is looking attractive again. With Bitcoin (BTC) trading around $95,000 and transaction fees hitting new highs after the 2024 halving, mining rewards â€” though smaller â€” are worth chasing. From home setups to industrial-scale farms, the question of whether Bitcoin mining is profitable is back in the spotlight.
And if youâ€™re a gamer, chances are youâ€™ve looked at your rig and wondered: Can a gaming PC mine crypto? After all, modern gaming computers are packed with powerful GPUs, solid cooling and lots of downtime, especially if youâ€™re not gaming daily. Itâ€™s a fair question: Can you mine Bitcoin with a gaming PC?
The short answer: Yes, but it wonâ€™t be worth it.Â 
The long answer:Â â€¦
articles.title: Can you mine Bitcoin with a gaming PC? Hereâ€™s what you need to know

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Ezra Reguerra
articles.description:
Almost 60,000 Bitcoin addresses tied to LockBitâ€™s ransomware infrastructure were leaked after hackers breached the groupâ€™s dark web affiliate panel.Â 
The leak included a MySQL database dump shared publicly online. It contained crypto-related information that could help blockchain analysts trace the groupâ€™s illicit financial flows.  
Ransomware is a type of malware used by malicious actors. It locks its targetâ€™s files or computer systems, making them inaccessible. The attackers typically demand a ransom payment, often in digital assets like Bitcoin (BTC), in exchange for a decryption key to unlock the files.
LockBit is one of the most notorious crypto ransomware groups. In February 2024, 10 countries launched a joint operation to disrupt the group, saying that the organization had caused biâ€¦
articles.title: 60K Bitcoin addresses leaked as LockBit ransomware gang gets hacked

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Amin Haqshanas
articles.description:
David Bailey, CEO of crypto media company BTC Inc. and a close adviser to US President Donald Trump on digital assets, has reportedly raised $300 million to launch a new Bitcoin investment firm.
The venture, named Nakamoto after the pseudonymous creator of Bitcoin, Satoshi Nakamoto, aims to become a publicly traded company focused on acquiring and holding the cryptocurrency, CNBC reported, citing people familiar with the matter. The InformationÂ was first to cover the story.
The funding round, which has been quietly in motion since January, includes $200 million in equity and $100 million in convertible debt, a source familiar with the matter told CNBC.
While the firm has not officially announced the raise, an official reveal and merger with a Nasdaq-listed company is expected as early as nâ€¦
articles.title: Trump crypto adviser David Bailey raises $300M for Bitcoin investment firm

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Stephen Katte
articles.description:
The US Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC) has confirmed banks under its jurisdiction can trade crypto on behalf of customers and outsource some crypto activities to third parties.Â 
Acting comptroller Rodney Hood said in a May 7 letter that banks and federal savings associations can buy and sell crypto they hold in custody at customersâ€™ direction.
The OCC added in a press release that financial institutions can also outsource bank-permissible crypto activities, including custody and execution services, to third parties in compliance with applicable law.
â€œAdditionally, these banks may provide other custody services, including record keeping, tax or reporting services for their customers,â€ Hood said in a May 7 video posted to X.Â 

OCC-regulated banks may buy and sell assets held â€¦
articles.title: US banks can handle customer crypto assets held in custody, regulator confirms

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Martin Young
articles.description:
Group of Seven (G7) leaders could discuss North Koreaâ€™s escalating cyberattacks and crypto thefts at an upcoming summit in Canada, mid-next month.
Conflicts in Ukraine and Gaza will dominate discussions, but North Koreaâ€™s increasing cyber threats and crypto hacks have become a major concern requiring a coordinated international response, Bloomberg reported on May 7, citing people familiar with the plans.
The people said North Koreaâ€™s nefarious cyber operations are alarming, as the stolen crypto has become a key funding source for the regime and its programs.Â 
North Korean-affiliated hacking groups such as the Lazarus Group have already stolen billions of dollars worth of crypto this year, including pulling off the $1.4 billion hack on Bybit in February, the largest ever for the crypto induâ€¦
articles.title: G7 summit could discuss North Koreaâ€™s crypto hacks: Report

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Ciaran Lyons
articles.description:
Bitcoiners expect Bitcoin to soon break past $100,000 and potentially hit a new all-time high as US President Donald Trump is set to announce a trade deal with the UK.
Trump said in a May 7 Truth Social post that a â€œmajor trade dealâ€ with a â€œbig, and highly respected, countryâ€ would be announced on May 8, which The New York Times reported would be the UK, citing three people familiar with the plans.
Bitcoin inches toward $100,000
When Trump published his post, Bitcoin (BTC) was trading at around $97,759 and has since crept up closer to the psychological $100,000 price level to trade at $99,140 at the time of publication, according to CoinMarketCap data.
Bitcoin is trading at $99,140 at the time of publication. Source: CoinMarketCap
Several Bitcoiners and analysts are crediting the rally toâ€¦
articles.title: Bitcoin nears $100K as Trump set to reveal trade deal with UK

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Brayden Lindrea
articles.description:
A Texas House Committee has passed a Republican-backed bill to create a Bitcoin reserve, which now only needs a successful full floor vote before heading to the governorâ€™s desk.
The Texas House Committee on Delivery of Government Efficiency passed Senate Bill 21 with no amendments on May 7 in a 9-4 vote along party lines. The bill has already passed the Texas Senate, in a 25-5 vote on March 6.  
SB 21 would establish the â€œTexas Strategic Bitcoin Reserve,â€ controlled by the stateâ€™s comptroller â€” currently Glenn Hegar â€” who would be permitted to invest in digital assets that have obtained a market cap of at least $500 billion over the last twelve months, which would currently only include Bitcoin (BTC).
Source: Pierre Rochard

Republican Senator Charles Schwertner initially introduced SB 21 â€¦
articles.title: Texas House committee passes Bitcoin reserve bill for full floor vote

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Ciaran Lyons
articles.description:
Bitcoin has reclaimed $98,000 for the first time in almost three months after the US Federal Reserve said it would keep interest rates the same for another month.
The Fedâ€™s decision to keep interest rates unchanged comes despite mounting pressure from US President Donald Trump, who just weeks ago threatened to fire Fed chair Jerome Powell for being â€œtoo lateâ€ in cutting rates.
Fed cites higher unemployment, inflation risk
Powell said on May 7 that the Federal Reserve rate-setting committee held rates in the 4.25% to 4.50% range due to the rising risks of higher unemployment and higher inflation.
He added inflation has â€œcome down a great deal but has been running above our 2% longer objective.â€ Powell said surveys in households and businesses showed a â€œsharp decline in sentimentâ€ mainly dueâ€¦
articles.title: Bitcoin returns to $98K as Fed holds rates steady despite Trumpâ€™s demand
